pr_title: Call default filter after custom filters

timeline.message:
Call default filter after custom filters

- Call the default filter after the custom filters
- Introduce a new filter result "WANTED" to signal
that a parser wants to parse it.

Resolves #6038

Signed-off-by: ricekot <ricekot@gmail.com>

Call default filter after custom filters

- Call the default filter after the custom filters
- Introduce a new filter result "WANTED" to signal
that a parser wants to parse it.

Resolves #6038

Signed-off-by: ricekot <ricekot@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText:
This could call the controller directly, we don't need to expose in the public API for now.
Could be done in the previous line as it no longer needs to be done last.
timeline.author: thc202

timeline.bodyText: Lets keep these methods internal for now (package accessible).
timeline.author: thc202

timeline.bodyText: This would have to be tweaked to "Setting default filter: ".
timeline.author: thc202

timeline.bodyText: This could skip some filters when WANTED, the suggestion was to call all of them to allow custom restrictions (regardless of the order they were added).
timeline.author: thc202

timeline.bodyText: Worth explaining that this skips the default filter, if no other filter filters it out.
timeline.author: thc202

timeline.message:
Call default filter after custom filters

- Call the default filter after the custom filters
- Introduce a new filter result "WANTED" to signal
that a parser wants to parse it. It allows the
resource to skip the default filter, if no other
filter filters it out.

Resolves #6038

Signed-off-by: ricekot <ricekot@gmail.com>
